snippet: The Dodd-Frank regulatory overhaul, the government's response to the 2008 financial crisis, was designed to be a slap in the face to Wall Street. But Mitt Romney, during the first debate of the presidential campaign, claims it was "the biggest kiss...
abstract: The Dodd-Frank regulatory overhaul, the government's response to the 2008 financial crisis, was designed to be a slap in the face to Wall Street. But Mitt Romney, during the first debate of the presidential campaign, claims it was "the biggest kiss that's been given to New York banks I've ever seen."

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
